description: Probably from iris, although the alteration of the vowel is unexplained.

entries.meaning: Any of several irises that have a fragrant root, especially Iris × germanica.
The fragrant root of such an iris.
examples: Drop twelve drops of genuine oil of rhodium on a lump of loaf-sugar ; grind this wel in a glass mortar, and mix it thoroughly with three pounds of orris powder.

description: Contracted from orfrays, or from arras.

entries.meaning: A type of gold or silver lace.
A pattern in which gold lace or silver lace is worked, especially one in which the edges are ornamented with conical figures placed at equal distances, with spots between them.
